thread.title: TV ratings: NBC's 'This Is Us' finishes season up, ABC's 'Bachelor' drops

author: USA TODAY
title: TV ratings: NBC's 'This Is Us' finishes season up, ABC's 'Bachelor' drops
text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs TV ratings: NBC's 'This Is Us' finishes season up, ABC's 'Bachelor' drops Gary Levin , USA TODAY 5:58 p.m. ET March 21, 2017 Nick Viall chooses Vanessa Grimaldi in the finale of 'The Bachelor' on ABC. (Photo: Terhi Tuovinen, ABC) 1 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
'Bachelor' finale. Nick and Vanessa, together forever? Maybe. But ABC's The Bachelor had its lowest finale Monday with 8.4 million same-day viewers (and 7.9 million for its After the Final Rose special), down from last year's 9.6 million. 
More sendoffs. NBC's This is Us set a series-high 12.8 million same-day viewers for Tuesday's first-season wrap-up (followed by 5.9 million for the debut of comedy Trial & Error ). Also exiting: Fox's Lethal Weapon (6 million) and Star (3.9 million, both Wednesday); ABC's The Real O'Neals (2.7 million Tuesday). 
Duane Notice of the South Carolina Gamecocks shoots the ball against Luke Kennard of the Duke Blue Devils in the NCAA men's basketball tournament. (Photo: Gregory Shamus, Getty Images) 
March madness. The first week of the NCAA men's basketball tournament averaged 9.3 million viewers on CBS, TNT, TBS and truTV, up from last year's 8.5 million, to its biggest total since 1993. Sunday's matchups drew 11.9 million, and helped CBS win the week among both viewers and young adults. <!--iframe-->
